decisions.description: Routes differently depending on whether the product is offered by Octopus Wealth, an Octopus Group company, or a 3rd party
decisions.name: Product_offered_by

Flow.description: Screen flow that walks a user through creating a piece of old process fulfilment.

validationRule.errorMessage: Must be between £0 and £2,500 for pensions, above £0 for Trusts, and between £0 and £2000 for all others
Must be between 0% and 2%
Must be above £0 for Trusts, and between £0 and £2000 for protection
Must be between 0% and 2%
Must be between £0 and £2,000
Must be between 0% and 2%

screens.description: Asks the user to choose a type of product and routes differently so we can have different flows for each.
screens.name: Choose_product_type
screens.label: Choose product type

fields.name: name_input
fields.helpText: Outline advice type, whether this is new/existing product, tax year deadline if it applies and include client name followed by first name, e.g. Lump sum to new OW SIPP, before 6th April - Gibbons, Jemma

validationRule.errorMessage: Woah, this ain't War and Peace! Limit this to 80 characters please...

fields.name: Fault_message
fields.fieldText:
There was an error creating the fulfilment. Please share this with an admin.


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}

fields.name: Fulfilment_created_message
fields.fieldText:
That was very fulfilling.


Choose an option below or click done.

fields.name: new_aua_input
fields.fieldText: Is this new assets under advice?

variables.description: An empty fulfilment variable so that this flow can be reused in a loop.
variables.name: fulfilment_empty

variables.description: The household for which this advice will be given
variables.name: household

variables.description: Sets the household ID to be the ID of the record from whose page this flow was launched.
variables.name: recordId
